subject: Law
title: Entrapment
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Entrapment.

hook.text: An undercover cop asks you to buy drugs ten times. You finally say yes. Were you entrapped?

buildup.text: Entrapment occurs when law enforcement induces someone to commit a crime they wouldn't have otherwise committed.

discovery.text: The key question: was the defendant predisposed to commit the crime, or did police create the criminal intent?

twist.text: Merely providing an opportunity isn't entrapment. Selling drugs to an undercover buyer who asked first isn't entrapment.

climax.text: Courts focus on the defendant's predisposition. Prior similar conduct makes the defense much harder to win.

quiz.question: What is the key factor in an entrapment defense?
options: Whether the defendant was predisposed to the crime
